page.title: 13An Ordinary Day (Cont.)
page.content:
The First School for 5 to 9 year olds is just opposite and the Middle School which caters for children up to age 13 is just next door. I hastily tuck a bag of crisps and perhaps a forgotten reading book into their school bags as I kiss them goodbye and Dennis tries in vain to leave the house before them. He is a Chartered Accountant with his own practice in Watham Cross ,a London suburb about 20 miles to the south of us.He likes to arrive before his staff at 9.30 am and is always the last to leave , often not getting home until very late at night , long after the chrildren are in bed.
Once all the family are out of the house , I stack the dishes in the dishwasher before having a shower and geting myself dressed and made up ready for the day ahead.I have a
